content.description: Fun, moderate warm up between burnt umber and Gypsy.
content.location: On right half of BR wall, start is same as burnt umber, then up bolts slightly right.

content.description: Start is left of afrodiety corner on dark, clean face with two bolts (5.9+) onto ledge, step left and ascend steep crack. The route contains a variety of climbing in such a short pitch, including crimps and slopers down low on the bolted section, to offwidth, tight hands, jugs, and stemming. Some of the rock in the crack, especially up high is soft and friable, it may clean up some over time but will likely add excitement to your day for years to come. Hopefully you wont come unhinged before the top-out!
content.protection: While not run out, some of the gear can at times be finicky, shallow, or in soft rock. Rack of 2 QD's, a couple alpines, and singles through #4 as the placement sizes vary along the route considerably.
content.location: Look for bolts on far left side of bob ross wall, just left of afrodiety on a clean/dark face below steep cracks.

content.description: Work through bulge and on to face with good thin rails. Can be connected to route extension above High Dive but lots of rope drag.
content.location: First far left route on lower Bob Ross (right side)

content.description: Steep start over nice jugs past two bolts, then into nice jams to top on gear. Fun and varied climbing.
content.protection: Two bolts then gear, roughly BD .75 through #4 singles, depending on what or where you want to place gear.
content.location: Starts in front of tree on left side of BR wall. Look for two bolts below crack.

content.description: Shares blocky start (and first four bolts) with Gypsy then transitions right, around corner and onto face.
content.location: On the right (West) half of Bob Ross wall.

content.description: Broken section to face with crimps.
content.location: In middle of BR wall, just right of dihedral,

content.description: Fun route with cool roof crux. Protects well with gear but climbs more like sport route.
content.protection: Singles BD .3 thru 3 An alpine draw and a couple of QD's might be helpful to reduce drag.
content.location: center portion of the wall, about 20ft left of large dihedral you will see a finger sized crack going through a bulge/roof. Thats the crux of the route.

content.description: Fun route. Crux is about half way up getting over a little hump.
content.location: Immediately to the right (west) of Apples and Oranges.

content.description: Work up through overhanging crack and some good holds on to face. .5 - #4. Use lower bolt for ledge belay.
content.location: Far right side of low Bob Ross

content.description: Past two bolts on black/clean face (shares this start with Unhinged). Then move up and slightly right toward steep hand and finger crack. Stem, jam, and crimp your way to 2 bolt anchor. The first ascent was done in June at 110 degrees, hence the name!
content.protection: 2 quick draws, 2 alpines, singles of .1, .5, 1, 2 and 4, double .4.
content.location: The start is two bolts on black face to left of afrodiety corner.

content.description: High Dive hugs the arete bulge above Burnt Umber. It can be done in one pitch by linking Burnt Umber into High Dive or...there's plenty of room to bring a friend or three up to the ledge. Either way it's a blast. Should be noted that there's a LOT of dirt on the diving board, also, mind your rope. Super fun and makes for the 'longest' route at Bob Ross.
content.location: Above Burnt Umber

content.description: Super fun roof with great positioning for opposing feet and back on opposite sides with a hand crack too!. Cool movement, wish is wasn't so short.Matt and I did this line on a whim and it turned out great, like Bob Ross says, sometimes unplanned events can be turned into something beautiful (happy accidents).
content.protection: singles  BD .5 to 3, although you will only use 2 or 3, it's nice to have options.
content.location: Left of Afrodiety on far left of BR wall, starts up on a ledge below an obvious roof.

climbs.name: Falling into Place
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Michael Genovese, Aaron Peterson FA 4/2/21, Sam Foreman FFA 4/11/21

content.description: Dihedral with crux getting from bolt 1 to bolt 2, Thin, technical feet on smears and thin edges in chimney-like movement but well protected by first bolt. After 2nd bolt traverse left to overhanging hand crack with some hero moves on loose rock but good pro. Top section 10-
content.location: Right of owl crack, up dihedral on clean, smooth rock then finishing crack to left of dihedral.

content.description: blocky start to dihedral with great stemming, tricky footwork, and small crimps. Fun. Closely bolted so it feels like you are always on toprope, even on lead.
content.location: On right half of BR wall, look for bolted dihedral.

content.description: Sweetly insecure. Delicate,  smeared feet up to a sharp crimp, grab the bull by the horns and pull thru the final easy moves. In loving memory of my father Wayne who taught me so much about patience, persistence, humility, compassion, and love.
content.location: Left end of Bob Ross wall.

content.description: But how do I start...A fun sequence of good crimps and some tricky beta to feel comfortable moving through 3rd bolt and get the clip. Move our right and jugs to the finish. A smart climber finds the fun no hands rest...
content.location: Left of Soul Food, second bolted when approaching from main trail up.

content.description: Short route with some burley moves.
content.protection: 4 bolts to an anchor with two leaver carabiners.
content.location: Just to the left of Chips and Salsa.

content.description: Crux bulge that leads in to fun short face climbing. Note: Best route for extending in to High Dive which makes for a fun 11 bolt route all the way up the wall.
content.location: On lower section of Bob Ross (right side) between Stretched Canvas and obvious gully of Usual Suspects.

content.description: Fun overhanging start, then a slab finish.
content.location: Left (east) side of the Bob Ross wall, but right of Soul Food.

content.description: Crux moves over a roof and on to face, some fun movement and specific beta makes it feel great and unique. 5 bolts, extend bolt 4.
content.location: Between My Way Or The Highway and Owl Crack

content.description: Same start as Call of the Wild. Shares first 2 or 3 bolts, depending on where you belay, then moves left to the crack.
Easier than it looks from the bottom. It's hard to TR because the rope gets pulled into the roof crack.
content.protection: Singles from .4 to 3. Sizes could vary depending on where you decide to put prof. Make sure you extend your pieces to reduce drag when you traverse left and through the roof.
content.location: Left of Burnt Umber is a short corner with hand crack to roof. Once over roof trend on ledge right to a short hand crack. Use alpine draws to extend pieces, especially those under roof.

content.description: The highest wall above wildlife canyon on left. From the right angle, and with the right pharmacological encouragement, it apparently looks like a profile of Bob Ross - who everyone knows is awesome!
